summary: The diff provides only truncated views of backend/main.mo and project_state.json. The truncated backend/main.mo snippet shows type definitions and data structures for the sendBTC flow (SendBTCRequest, TransferStatus, etc.) but does not include the actual sendBTC method implementation where user registration validation would be removed. Without visibility into the sendBTC method code or error handling logic, it is impossible to verify whether REQ-202 (removal of user registration checks) or REQ-203 (updated error handling to rely only on blockchain API validation) have been implemented.

missing_requirements.requirement: Remove all backend code in the sendBTC method that validates whether the destination Bitcoin address corresponds to a registered user account or user profile
missing_requirements.reason: The diff of backend/main.mo is truncated and does not show the sendBTC method implementation. No evidence of removed user registration validation code is visible in the provided snippet, which only contains type definitions and state variables.

missing_requirements.requirement: Update backend error handling or validation logic in the sendBTC flow to ensure address format validation only checks Bitcoin mainnet address syntax via the blockchain API, not app user registry existence
missing_requirements.reason: The diff of backend/main.mo is truncated and does not show error handling logic or validation code within the sendBTC flow. No evidence of updated error handling that references blockchain API validation instead of user registry checks is visible.
